# Get Next Line (GNL)

![GNL Logo](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/115947494/242113519-20a982a3-4d8e-4c6f-aa9b-4eafa6888bd6.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJnaXRodWIuY29tIiwiYXVkIjoicmF3LmdpdGh1YnVzZXJjb250ZW50LmNvbSIsImtleSI6ImtleTEiLCJleHAiOjE3MDM3OTAxMjgsIm5iZiI6MTcwMzc4OTgyOCwicGF0aCI6Ii8xMTU5NDc0OTQvMjQyMTEzNTE5LTIwYTk4MmEzLTRkOGUtNGM2Zi1hYTliLTRlYWZhNjg4OGJkNi5wbmc_.3aXPYtoukrafeoAFbSpa_Cs1YeYx-EgRDYMtMUN39Jk)

## Description
Get Next Line (GNL) is a 42 project that allows reading one line at a time from a file or standard input.

This project was developed as part of the 42 curriculum and aims to enhance file reading skills and buffer manipulation in C language.

## Features
- **Line Reading:** Ability to read a line from a file or standard input.
- **Multifile Support:** Processing multiple files simultaneously.
- **Buffer Management:** Efficient handling of buffers for reading.

## Prerequisites
- Unix-based operating system (Linux or macOS) for compilation.
- GCC or Clang compiler.

## How to Use
1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/your_username/your_project.git
